channel.title: How to use an ObjectID
channel.description: I saw many people who dosent know how to add an ObjectID, and ObjectID is an object that when you click that object it gonna do something. its too easy to add it. put that code in client.java. we will add a chest to check it. [code] if(objectID == 2417){//Object id so when you click that object what will happen (CHEST ID) { if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000)){ //cost 100K to play. deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);// if you do have 100K so delete 100K. addItem(995, misc.random(200000));//adds you amount of money untill 200K }else sendMessage("You need 100K to do this action.");//sends message if you dont have 100K and abort all the action ^ ^ } [/code] You can add also thing like [code] if(useItemID == 989 && atObjectID == 2417) { //if you use a key on the object id 2417 basicly its like before just now you can use the item 989 on the objec t 2417 } [/code] Easy but useful.

item.title: How to use an ObjectID
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:14, topic:489818”][quote author=Sup22211 link=topic=608053.msg4236034#msg4236034 date=1361565369]
WHAT IS “conventions”?? what do you mean by i changed conventions??
[/quote]
Conventions basically means easier to read. If it looks like this:

if(code() == true) { if(otherCode() == true) { if(thirdCode() == true) { executeThis(); } } }

if(code() == true && otherCode() == true && thirdCode == true) { executeThis(); }

The second one has better conventions, I’m not sure which is the best way to handle this, but that’s the best I know of.[/quote]

if(code() && otherCode() && thirdCode == true) { executeThis(); }

or you can just make the if-statement return true, or create another void to return true. furthermore, you can also make the void’s return true, instead of false.
??

Read full topic

item.title: How to use an ObjectID
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Sup22211:

WHAT IS “conventions”?? what do you mean by i changed conventions??

Conventions basically means easier to read. If it looks like this:

if(code() == true) { if(otherCode() == true) { if(thirdCode() == true) { executeThis(); } } }

if(code() == true && otherCode() == true && thirdCode == true) { executeThis(); }

The second one has better conventions, I’m not sure which is the best way to handle this, but that’s the best I know of.

Read full topic

item.title: How to use an ObjectID
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:10, topic:489818”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=608053.msg4234948#msg4234948 date=1361505421]

		if (objectID == 2417) {// The ID of the object being used
			if (playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000)) { // It takes 100,000 of 995 (coins) to yield this true
				deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);// Deletes the 100,000 coins from your inventory
				addItem(995, misc.random(200000)); // Randomly adds an amount of coins from 0 - 199,999
			} else // Yields false if you do not have 100,000 coins
				sendMessage("You need 100,000 coins to complete this action."); // Tells you the amount of coins required if yielded false
		}

^^ Looks more appealing to my eyes.
[/quote]

if(objectID == 2417){//Object id so when you click that object what will happen (CHEST ID) { if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000)){ //cost 100K to play. deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);// if you do have 100K so delete 100K. addItem(995, misc.random(200000));//adds you amount of money untill 200K }else sendMessage("You need 100K to do this action.");//sends message if you dont have 100K and abort all the action ^ ^ }
Huh? nothing changed…[/quote]conventions.

Read full topic

				deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);// Deletes the 100,000 coins from your inventory

item.title: How to use an ObjectID
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:1, topic:489818”] if(objectID == 2417){//The ID of the object being used if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000)){ //It takes 100,000 of 995 (coins) to yield this true deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);//Deletes the 100,000 coins from your inventory addItem(995, misc.random(200000)); //Randomly adds an amount of coins from 0 - 199,999 } else { //Yields false if you do not have 100,000 coins sendMessage("You need 100,000 coins to complete this action."); //Tells you the amount of coins required if yielded false } }

if(useItemID == item ID && atObjectID == object ID) { //Yields false if the item and object ID are not being used on each other //Same code as above, but instead of set IDs, you can put your own. //Where it says "item ID", put the ID of an item being used //Where it says "object ID", put the ID of the object at use. } [/quote]

Fixed your codes, just the basics of it, though. 100 errors waiting to happen.

Read full topic

item.title: How to use an ObjectID
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

I saw many people who dosent know how to add an ObjectID, and ObjectID is an object that when you click that object it gonna do something.
its too easy to add it.
put that code in client.java. we will add a chest to check it.

                               if(objectID == 2417){//Object id so when you click that object what will happen (CHEST ID) {
if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 100000)){ //cost 100K to play.
deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 100000);// if you do have 100K so delete 100K.
addItem(995, misc.random(200000));//adds you amount of money untill 200K
        }else
sendMessage("You need 100K to do this action.");//sends message if you dont have 100K and abort all the action ^ ^
}

You can add also thing like

if(useItemID == 989 && atObjectID == 2417) { //if you use a key on the object id  2417
basicly its like before just now you can use the item 989 on the objec t 2417
}

Easy but useful.

Read full topic
